channel.title: .. got a prob here.... mopar client problem
channel.description:
mmkay...
just got a new comp have java and everything installed i went to run the moparscape client and the download times out so i say.. whatever it would do that anyway since i'm on dialup so i copied and pasted the cache from a different computer thru a flash drive. no problems, this is how i got it to the other computer and the other computer works fine on mopar so i copied the cache into my windows file and it doesnt see it i think its because im running windows 2000 so the main windows file is WINNT when its looking for WINDOWS so i made another folder called WINDOWS and i copied the cache into there. still doesnt work. i can go into dos and do c:/cd windows c:windows/cd .mpr_file_store_32 and it opens the cache folder but when moparscape looks for it, it doesnt see it i might need mopar on this one.. also the 2 computers that do run the clients are WINME and WIN2000- the windows 2000 version has to run off of the web client though
help PLEEEZ! :(

item.title: .. got a prob here.... mopar client problem
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

you could jsut go onto www.moparisthebest.com and let it download from the online client thats what i did

Read full topic

item.title: .. got a prob here.... mopar client problem
item.dc:creator: @Fallen_Angel Fallen Angel
item.description:
@Fallen_Angel wrote:

mmkay…

just got a new comp have java and everything installed
i went to run the moparscape client and the download times out
so i say… whatever it would do that anyway since i’m on dialup
so i copied and pasted the cache from a different computer thru a flash drive.
no problems, this is how i got it to the other computer and the other computer works fine on mopar
so i copied the cache into my windows file and it doesnt see it
i think its because im running windows 2000 so the main windows file is WINNT when its looking for WINDOWS
so i made another folder called WINDOWS and i copied the cache into there.
still doesnt work. i can go into dos and do c:/cd windows c:windows/cd .mpr_file_store_32 and it opens the cache folder but when moparscape looks for it, it doesnt see it
i might need mopar on this one…
also the 2 computers that do run the clients are WINME and WIN2000- the windows 2000 version has to run off of the web client though

help PLEEEZ!

Read full topic
item.source: .. got a prob here.... mopar client problem
